Review and curate VS Code extensions
description: Audit the current VS Code extension lists and propose additions. Two sources exist: (1) _todo_resources/vscode-exts.md — 24 extensions (gitlens, githistory, PowerShell, markdown-all-in-one, python, eslint, prettier, remote-wsl, yaml, xml, Go, remote-ssh, markdownlint, github-pr, drawio, markmap, slidev, csharp, jupyter, shellcheck, rust-analyzer). (2) gamer-build-files install-apps.cmd — 40+ extensions (superset of above, plus Docker, Terraform, CloudCode, Azure, AWS, Copilot, LiveShare, etc.). Tasks: (a) Merge both lists, deduplicate. (b) Categorise by purpose (core, language-specific, cloud/infra, productivity). (c) Map to machine types (personal gets all, work gets subset, minimal gets none). (d) Research and suggest additional extensions based on the user's stack: chezmoi/dotfiles, zsh, Go, Python, Rust, .NET, Node/TS, Terraform, AWS/Azure/GCP, Docker, GitHub, markdown/docs. (e) Flag any deprecated or superseded extensions. (f) Propose the canonical list for the chezmoi-managed install script.
close_reason: Completed in Phase 11 PR #44 — extensions curated and auto-install implemented

title: Consolidate specs into single requirements document
description: The specs/ directory has 7 files (spec.md, plan.md, research.md, tasks.md, quickstart.md, checklists/requirements.md, checklists/testing.md) from an earlier spec-driven workflow that isn't being followed. Consolidate the valuable content into a single REQUIREMENTS.md (or similar) with sections: Constraints, Principles, Requirements, Key Decisions, Open Items. Also clean up scaffolding directories: .specify/ (templates, scripts, memory/constitution.md), .gemini/ (commands), _todo_resources/ (3 files: vscode-exts.md, fix-wsl-path.sh, win-term-profile.ps1 — migrate useful content first). The quickstart.md content should move to the root README.md (see sister issue).

title: Migrate Windows app installs from gamer-build-files repo
description: The private repo desertfoxclan/gamer-build-files has rebuild-src/install-apps.cmd with comprehensive winget installs for Windows. This should be migrated into the dotfiles chezmoi structure. Current content in install-apps.cmd: Core apps (NVIDIA, VC++ redist), Dev tools (VS Code, IntelliJ, Git, Docker, Hugo, etc.), Languages (Go, Node, Java, Python, Anaconda, Rust, .NET 9, Ruby), Cloud SDKs (AWS, Azure, GCP), VS Code extensions (40+), System utilities (CrystalDiskInfo, HWiNFO, etc.), Office (via office-config.xml), General tools (7-Zip, VLC, Chrome, Discord, Bitwarden), Games (Steam, Epic, GOG, etc.), Windows Store apps (Affinity suite), PowerShell modules, Registry tweaks. Migration approach: (1) Add winget package IDs to .chezmoi.toml.tmpl under a windows/personal machine type. (2) Create run_once_install-windows-apps.ps1.tmpl using chezmoi templates. (3) Separate into categories (dev, gaming, productivity) that can be toggled per machine type. (4) Handle VS Code extensions separately (merge with existing extension management). (5) Migrate registry tweaks to run_once_setup-windows-environment.ps1.tmpl.

title: Add bat/delta shell aliases and consistent CLI UX
description: bat and delta are installed but the shell doesn't default to them. Add alias cat=bat, set BAT_THEME, export EDITOR='code --wait', and tie the whole tool chain together into a cohesive CLI experience.

title: Activate age-encrypted secrets management
description: The entire secrets pipeline is designed and documented but not turned on. .chezmoi.toml has no [age] section, and dot_secrets.tmpl is a placeholder. Until this is live, API keys have to be manually managed on each machine, defeating the purpose of chezmoi. Steps: generate age key, add [age] to .chezmoi.toml, chezmoi add --encrypt ~/.secrets, update .chezmoiignore for conditional handling, document key storage in Bitwarden.

title: Review docs and populate root README.md
description: The docs/ directory has 5 files totalling ~2900 lines: BACKUP_RECOVERY.md (577), MAINTENANCE.md (521), MIGRATION.md (649), TESTING.md (332), TROUBLESHOOTING.md (830). For a personal dotfiles repo, much of this is over-engineered. Propose a trimmed documentation set. Candidates for trimming/merging: MIGRATION.md (one-time use, could become a section in README), BACKUP_RECOVERY.md (mostly theoretical — keep age key backup essentials, drop the rest). The root README.md is currently empty and should become the primary entry point covering: what this repo is, quickstart install, what's included (tools/platforms), machine types, and links to detailed docs. Also review CONTRIBUTING.md, AGENTS.md, GEMINI.md at root level for relevance.

title: Add dotfiles shell aliases and update README
description: Add a dedicated aliases file to zsh config, create dotup alias (chezmoi update -v) and dotstatus function (shows machine type, last applied, pending changes). Update README update section to recommend chezmoi update as primary method.

title: CLI menu-driven machine type selection for chezmoi init
description: Add an interactive CLI menu during chezmoi init that asks what 'type' of machine is being provisioned (e.g. personal, work, server/minimal). On a work machine, all config should be applied but application installation should be selective — skip most Brewfile apps and VS Code extensions, but still install 'essential' software. This requires: (1) a chezmoi template prompt or init script that sets a machine_type data field, (2) conditional logic in Brewfile.tmpl to split packages into essential vs full, (3) conditional VS Code extension installation, (4) persisting the choice in .chezmoi.toml so subsequent applies respect it.

title: Fix Starship language version check timeouts
description: On work machine, Python and Go version checks in Starship regularly exceed the 500ms default timeout, cluttering shell output with warnings. Fix: set command_timeout = 2000 (2 seconds) in the Starship config. This applies across all machine types. The Starship config is likely at home/dot_config/starship.toml or similar chezmoi-managed path.

title: Investigate and automate maintenance tasks
description: Review what maintenance the dotfiles repo needs and how much is already automated. Current automation: (1) package-updates.yml — weekly check for Homebrew outdated + Starship releases, creates GitHub issues. (2) ghostty-terminfo.yml — weekly regeneration of xterm-ghostty terminfo. (3) dependabot.yml — weekly GitHub Actions version bumps. (4) pre-commit — markdownlint-cli2. Gaps to investigate: (a) No automated chezmoi version tracking. (b) No Oh My Zsh plugin update detection. (c) No shell startup time regression monitoring. (d) No automated apt/winget package freshness checks (only Homebrew). (e) docs/MAINTENANCE.md describes monthly/quarterly/annual tasks but none are automated or tracked. (f) No Brewfile.lock or pinned versions for reproducibility. Propose which gaps are worth filling and how (GitHub Actions, chezmoi hooks, or manual checklist).

title: Wire up .zshrc tool integrations (fzf, nvm, jenv, EDITOR)
description: fzf, nvm, and jenv are all installed via Homebrew but never initialized in .zshrc. Also remove debug echo statements and set $EDITOR. This is the highest-bang-for-buck fix — it's the daily shell experience.
